title: Authors and Citation
text: Salim Brüggemann. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brüggemann S (2024). gitlab: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API. R package version 0.0.9000, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab, https://gitlab.rpkg.dev.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gitlab: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API},   author = {Salim Brüggemann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.9000, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab},   url = {https://gitlab.rpkg.dev}, }

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: Allows conveniently work GitLab’s v4 RESTful API R. GitLab (https://gitlab.com) open-source DevOps software suite .. includes powerful Git forge.

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: install latest development version gitlab, run following R:
code: if (!("remotes" %in% rownames(installed.packages()))) {   install.packages(pkgs = "remotes",                    repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org/") }  remotes::install_gitlab(repo = "rpkg.dev/gitlab")

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: (function) reference found .

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: gitlab’s functionality controlled via package-specific global configuration can either set via R options environment variables (former take precedence). configuration includes:

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: package’s source code written R Markdown file format facilitate practices commonly referred literate programming. allows actual code freely mixed explanatory supplementary information expressive Markdown format instead rely # comments . .gen.R suffixed R source code found R/ generated respective R Markdown counterparts Rmd/ using pkgpurl::purl_rmd()1. Always make changes .Rmd files – never .R files – run pkgpurl::purl_rmd() regenerate R source files.

title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API
text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code adheres principles specified Tidyverse Design Guide wherever possible formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable2. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed3. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/gitlab.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified pkgpurl::default_linters, (default) used pkgpurl::lint_rmd(), turn recommended way lint package.
code: # TSG proposes this do_something_very_complicated(   something = "that",   requires = many,   arguments = "some of which may be long" )  # we prefer this do_something_very_complicated(something = "that",                               requires = many,                               arguments = "some of which may be long")

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
text: Assembles HTTP request structure common GitLab v4 RESTful API requests performed package.

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
code: api_req(   path,   method = c("GET", "CONNECT", "DELETE", "HEAD", "OPTIONS", "PATCH", "POST", "PUT",     "TRACE"),   url_params = NULL,   body_json = NULL,   auto_unbox = TRUE,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
text: path character(1) Endpoint path relative GitLab API base_url. method character(1)HTTP request method. One "GET", "CONNECT", "DELETE", "HEAD", "OPTIONS", "PATCH", "POST", "PUT" "TRACE". url_params list() URL parameters added query string. Either NULL omit named list key-value pairs define query parameters. Values must scalars. opt automatic conversion non-character values JSON strings percent-encoding values, wrap values (). body_json list() Data include JSON HTTP request body. NULL means empty body. auto_unbox logical(1) Whether automatically "unbox" length-1 vectors body_json JSON scalars. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
text: httr2::req_method return

title: Create GitLab API request — api_req
code: # let's call the `/metadata` endpoint (https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/metadata.html) gitlab::api_req(path = "/metadata",                 method = "GET") |>   httr2::req_perform() |>   httr2::resp_body_json() #> $version #> [1] "17.7.0-pre" #>  #> $revision #> [1] "fdcff1f8f32" #>  #> $kas #> $kas$enabled #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $kas$externalUrl #> [1] "wss://kas.gitlab.com" #>  #> $kas$externalK8sProxyUrl #> [1] "https://kas.gitlab.com/k8s-proxy" #>  #> $kas$version #> [1] "17.7.0+9fd3ef87a54f73b17bf775d30b2153e8b242cf1c" #>  #>  #> $enterprise #> [1] TRUE #>

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
text: Assembles URL specified repository path GitLab's web interface.

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
code: build_url(   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   ...,   ref = "HEAD",   force_branch_ref = FALSE,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
text: id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ... character() Optional path components added repository base URL. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Omitted NULL, otherwise set URL parameter API request. Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. force_branch_ref logical(1) Whether force ref interpreted branch name adding ref_type=heads URL parameter. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
text: character scalar.

title: Build GitLab repository URL — build_url
code: gitlab::build_url(id_project = 64767928,                   "Rmd/gitlab.Rmd") #> [1] "https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab/-/tree/HEAD/Rmd/gitlab.Rmd"

what: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
title: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
text: Creates Git commit multiple file actions including "create", "delete", "move", "update" "chmod" via POST /projects/{id_project}/repository/commits endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
code: commit_files(   actions,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url,     token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   start_sha = NULL,   start_project = NULL,   branch = start_branch,   commit_message = "auto: modify files via gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   incl_stats = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
text: actions data.frame Commit actions data returned file_commit_action(). data frame columns action, file_path, previous_path, content, encoding, last_commit_id execute_filemode (first two columns mandatory). id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. start_sha character(1) SHA value commit create branch . Alternative start_branch. start_project character(1) GitLab project ID URL-encoded path project start new branch . Defaults value id. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. incl_stats logical(1) Whether include commit statistics result. force logical(1) Whether overwrite branch new commit based start_branch start_sha. Equivalent git push --force. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error. quiet logical(1) Whether suppress printing status output internal processing.

title: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
text: list metadata created commit, invisibly.

title: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
text: See official API documentation details actions columns meaning.

title: Create a commit with multiple file actions — commit_files
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ list(gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.txt",                                 action = "create",                                 content = "anyone there?"),      gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "old_test.txt",                                 action = "delete")) |>   purrr::list_rbind() |>   commit_files(id_project = 64767928)} # }

what: Delete directory from GitLab repository — dir_delete
title: Delete directory from GitLab repository — dir_delete
text: Deletes files (Git blob objects) submodule references (Git commit objects) within directory GitLab repository, effectively deleting directory (Git tree object), single Git commit. High-level convenience function combines dir_ls() files_delete().

title: Delete directory from GitLab repository — dir_delete
code: dir_delete(   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url,     token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   start_sha = NULL,   start_project = NULL,   branch = start_branch,   commit_message = "auto: delete directory via gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   incl_stats = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   last_commit_id = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Delete directory from GitLab repository — dir_delete
text: path character(1) Directory path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. start_sha character(1) SHA value commit create branch . Alternative start_branch. start_project character(1) GitLab project ID URL-encoded path project start new branch . Defaults value id. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. incl_stats logical(1) Whether include commit statistics result. force logical(1) Whether overwrite branch new commit based start_branch start_sha. Equivalent git push --force. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab proceed commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. considered "delete", "move" "update" actions. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Delete directory from GitLab repository — dir_delete
text: list metadata created commit, invisibly.

title: Delete directory from GitLab repository — dir_delete
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gitlab::dir_delete(path = "docs/dev",                    id_project = 64767928)} # }

what: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
title: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
text: Tests whether directory (Git tree object) exists GitLab repository.

title: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
code: dir_exists(   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   ref = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
text: path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Omitted NULL, otherwise set URL parameter API request. Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
text: logical scalar.

title: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
text: dir_exists() makes light-weight HTTP HEAD request properly handles HTTP 404 Found errors.

title: Test if directory exists in GitLab repository — dir_exists
code: gitlab::dir_exists(path = "docs",                    id_project = 64767928) #> [1] TRUE  gitlab::dir_exists(path = "no/no/nope",                    id_project = 64767928) #> [1] FALSE

what: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
text: Lists file directory names found specified path GitLab repository via GET /projects/:id/repository/tree endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
code: dir_ls(   path = "",   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   recurse = FALSE,   ref = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url, token =     token, max_tries = max_tries),   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
text: path character(1) Directory path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. recurse logical(1) Whether recurse subdirectories path. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Omitted NULL, otherwise set URL parameter API request. Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
text: tibble.

title: List files and directories in GitLab repository — dir_ls
code: gitlab::dir_ls(id_project = 64767928,                path = "Rmd") #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   id                                       name               type  path                   mode   #>   <chr>                                    <chr>              <chr> <chr>                  <chr>  #> 1 dac2d705732cbbfb90fd56b53ce307dd5510354d gitlab.Rmd         blob  Rmd/gitlab.Rmd         100644 #> 2 bec8d2f0a6ffc62a1c45d89aa658eeb65181c1c6 sysdata.nopurl.Rmd blob  Rmd/sysdata.nopurl.Rmd 100644  # look for the pkgdown sitemap(s) gitlab::dir_ls(id_project = 64767928,                path = "docs",                recurse = TRUE) |>   dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(name, "\\.xml$")) |>   dplyr::pull("path") #> [1] "docs/dev/sitemap.xml"

title: Assemble file commit action — file_commit_action
text: Creates actions data row ready fed commit_files().

title: Assemble file commit action — file_commit_action
code: file_commit_action(   path,   action = c("create", "delete", "move", "update", "chmod"),   content = NULL,   from_file = FALSE,   previous_path = NULL,   execute_filemode = NULL,   last_commit_id = NULL )

title: Assemble file commit action — file_commit_action
text: path character(1) Path file acted , relative repository root. action = "move", destination path move file . action character(1) Action take file. One "create", "delete", "move", "update" "chmod". content character(1) raw() File content, character scalar text files, raw vector binary files. path local file character scalar from_file = TRUE. considered "create" "update" actions. from_file logical(1) Whether content indicates path local file instead actual file content. previous_path character(1) Original path file moved. considered action = "move". execute_filemode logical(1) Whether mark uploaded file executable. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab proceed commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. considered "delete", "move" "update" actions.

title: Assemble file commit action — file_commit_action
text: tibble row columns action, file_path, previous_path, content, encoding, last_commit_id execute_filemode.

title: Assemble file commit action — file_commit_action
code:
# totally silly sequence of file actions to commit list(gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.txt",                                 action = "create",                                 content = "anyone there?"),      gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.txt",                                 action = "update",                                 content = "#!/bin/sh

echo 'anyone there?'
"),      gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.sh",                                 action = "move",                                 previous_path = "test.txt"),      gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.sh",                                 action = "chmod",                                 execute_filemode = TRUE),      gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.sh",                                 action = "delete")) |>   purrr::list_rbind() #> # A tibble: 5 × 6 #>   file_path action content                               encoding previous_path execute_filemode #>   <chr>     <chr>  <chr>                                 <chr>    <chr>         <lgl>            #> 1 test.txt  create "anyone there?"                       text     NA            NA               #> 2 test.txt  update "#!/bin/sh

echo 'anyone there?'
" text     NA            NA               #> 3 test.sh   move    NA                                   NA       test.txt      NA               #> 4 test.sh   chmod   NA                                   NA       NA            TRUE             #> 5 test.sh   delete  NA                                   NA       NA            NA                # to create/update a file on GitLab with a local file's content if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gitlab::file_commit_action(path = "test.txt",                            action = "create",                            content = "/PATH/TO/LOCAL/FILE",                            from_file = TRUE)} # }

what: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content

text: Downloads file GitLab repository via GET /projects/{id_project}/repository/files/{path}/raw endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API returns content.

code: file_content(   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   ref = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
text: path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Omitted NULL, otherwise set URL parameter API request. Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
text: character scalar path refers text file, otherwise raw vector.

title: Read in file from GitLab repository — file_content
code: gitlab::file_content(path = "DESCRIPTION",                      id_project = 64767928,                      ref = "9c2fe95c63fef013205fe5ff64dd30494579f3f2") |>   cat() #> Package: gitlab #> Title: Use GitLab's v4 RESTful API #> Version: 0.0.9000 #> Authors@R:  #>     person("Salim", "Brüggemann", , "salim-b@pm.me", role = c("aut", "cre"), #>            comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-5329-5987")) #> Description: Allows to conveniently work with GitLab's v4 RESTful API from #>     R. GitLab (https://gitlab.com) is an open-source DevOps software suite #>     that i.a. includes a powerful Git forge. #> License: AGPL (>= 3) #> URL: https://gitlab.rpkg.dev, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab #> BugReports: https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/gitlab/issues #> Depends:  #>     R (>= 4.4) #> Imports:  #>     base64enc (>= 0.1.3), #>     brio (>= 1.1.5), #>     checkmate (>= 2.3.2), #>     cli (>= 3.6.3), #>     digest (>= 0.6.37), #>     dplyr (>= 1.1.4), #>     fs (>= 1.6.5), #>     glue (>= 1.8.0), #>     heck (>= 0.1.3), #>     httr2 (>= 1.0.6), #>     jsonlite (>= 1.8.9), #>     magrittr (>= 2.0.3), #>     pal (>= 0.0.9101), #>     purrr (>= 1.0.2), #>     rlang (>= 1.1.4), #>     stringr (>= 1.5.1), #>     tibble (>= 3.2.1) #> Encoding: UTF-8 #> LazyData: true #> Roxygen: list(markdown = TRUE) #> RoxygenNote: 7.3.2.9000

what: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
text: Creates new file GitLab repository via POST /projects/{id_project}/repository/files/{path} endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
code: file_create(   content,   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url,     token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   branch = start_branch,   commit_message = "auto: create file via gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   encoding = c("text", "base64"),   execute_filemode = FALSE,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
text: content character(1) raw() File content, character scalar text files, raw vector binary files. path local file character scalar from_file = TRUE. path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. encoding character(1) File encoding. One "text" "base64". execute_filemode logical(1) Whether mark uploaded file executable. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
text: list metadata newly created file.

title: Create file in GitLab repository — file_create
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gitlab::file_create(content = "a line of text",                     path = "test.md",                     id_project = 64767928)} # }

title: Delete file from GitLab repository — file_delete
text: path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab write file commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: GitLab file data — file_full
code: gitlab::file_full(path = "DESCRIPTION",                   id_project = 64767928,                   ref = "9c2fe95c63fef013205fe5ff64dd30494579f3f2") #> $file_name #> [1] "DESCRIPTION" #>  #> $file_path #> [1] "DESCRIPTION" #>  #> $size #> [1] 1055 #>  #> $encoding #> [1] "base64" #>  #> $content_sha256 #> [1] "052e6000c95e374a5cf0eb2003c13373c17746cf2b129d43df3ef148b0d9099f" #>  #> $ref #> [1] "9c2fe95c63fef013205fe5ff64dd30494579f3f2" #>  #> $blob_id #> [1] "98c56652d8eb2ccdedd4a2ef60d3196c6a6a794c" #>  #> $commit_id #> [1] "9c2fe95c63fef013205fe5ff64dd30494579f3f2" #>  #> $last_commit_id #> [1] "9c2fe95c63fef013205fe5ff64dd30494579f3f2" #>  #> $execute_filemode #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $content #> [1] "" #>

title: GitLab file metadata — file_meta
text: Retrieves file's metadata via HEAD /projects/{id_project}/repository/files/{path} endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: GitLab file metadata — file_meta
code: file_meta(   path,   attribute = c("file_name", "file_path", "size", "encoding", "content_sha256", "ref",     "blob_id", "commit_id", "last_commit_id", "execute_filemode"),   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   ref = "HEAD",   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: GitLab file metadata — file_meta
text: path character(1) File path, relative repository root. attribute character(1) Name metadata attribute return. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Omitted NULL, otherwise set URL parameter API request. Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: GitLab file metadata — file_meta
text: integer scalar attribute = "size", logical scalar attribute = "execute_filemode", character scalar cases. Note empty vector returned invalid refs.

title: GitLab file metadata — file_meta
code: gitlab::file_meta(path = "README.md",                   attribute = "execute_filemode",                   id_project = 64767928) #> [1] FALSE

what: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
text: Assembles HTTP request structure common GitLab v4 RESTful API requests manage files performed package.

title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
code: file_req(   method,   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   ref = NULL,   body_json = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
text: method character(1)HTTP request method. One "GET", "CONNECT", "DELETE", "HEAD", "OPTIONS", "PATCH", "POST", "PUT" "TRACE". path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. ref character(1)Git revision expression matching desired Git tree object, e.g. ref name (branch, tag, etc.), commit identifier, another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". Omitted NULL, otherwise set URL parameter API request. Note GitLab API support every type revision expression. body_json list() Data include JSON HTTP request body. NULL means empty body. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
text: httr2::req_method return

title: Create GitLab file management API request — file_req
code: gitlab:::file_req(method = "HEAD",                   path = "README.md",                   id_project = 64767928,                   ref = "HEAD") #> <httr2_request> #> HEAD https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/64767928/repository/files/README.md?ref=HEAD #> Headers: #> • PRIVATE-TOKEN: '<REDACTED>' #> Body: empty #> Policies: #> • retry_max_tries: 3 #> • retry_on_failure: FALSE #> • error_body: a function

what: Update file in GitLab repository — file_update
title: Update file in GitLab repository — file_update
text: Updates existing file GitLab repository via PUT /projects/{id_project}/repository/files/{path} endpoint GitLab's v4 RESTful API.

title: Update file in GitLab repository — file_update
code: file_update(   content,   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url,     token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   branch = start_branch,   commit_message = "auto: update file gitlab gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   encoding = c("text", "base64"),   execute_filemode = FALSE,   last_commit_id = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Update file in GitLab repository — file_update
text: content character(1) raw() File content, character scalar text files, raw vector binary files. path local file character scalar from_file = TRUE. path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. encoding character(1) File encoding. One "text" "base64". execute_filemode logical(1) Whether mark uploaded file executable. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab write file commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

what: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: Uploads file GitLab repository via GitLab's v4 RESTful API. High-level function default skips uploading identical file content automatically choses file_create() file_update() based whether file already exists .

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
code: file_write(   content,   path,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url,     token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   branch = start_branch,   from_file = FALSE,   overwrite = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   commit_message = "auto: write file via gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   execute_filemode = FALSE,   last_commit_id = file_meta(path = path, attribute = "last_commit_id", id_project =     id_project, ref = branch, base_url = base_url, token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: content character(1) raw() File content, character scalar text files, raw vector binary files. path local file character scalar from_file = TRUE. path character(1) File path, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . from_file logical(1) Whether content indicates path local file instead actual file content. overwrite logical(1) Whether overwrite already existing file. Unless force = TRUE, file overwritten identical content. force logical(1) Whether overwrite already existing file even identical content. commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. execute_filemode logical(1) Whether mark uploaded file executable. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab write file commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error. quiet logical(1) Whether suppress printing status output internal processing.

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: path, invisibly.

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
text: save two additional HEAD requests, set start_branch last_commit_id explicitly. Setting last_commit_id = NULL fine long file writes part controlled, single-user process concurrency concern.

title: Write file to GitLab repository — file_write
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gitlab::file_write(content = "a line of text",                    path = "test.md",                    id_project = 64767928)} # }

what: Delete multiple files from GitLab repository — files_delete
title: Delete multiple files from GitLab repository — files_delete
text: Deletes multiple files GitLab repository single Git commit. High-level convenience function combines file_commit_action() commit_files().

title: Delete multiple files from GitLab repository — files_delete
code: files_delete(   paths,   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   start_branch = project_default_branch(id_project = id_project, base_url = base_url,     token = token, max_tries = max_tries),   start_sha = NULL,   start_project = NULL,   branch = start_branch,   commit_message = "auto: delete files via gitlab R pkg",   author_email = NULL,   author_name = NULL,   incl_stats = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   last_commit_id = NULL,   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: Delete multiple files from GitLab repository — files_delete
text: paths character() File paths, relative repository root. id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. start_branch character(1) Name base branch create branch already exist. start_sha character(1) SHA value commit create branch . Alternative start_branch. start_project character(1) GitLab project ID URL-encoded path project start new branch . Defaults value id. branch character(1) Git branch name upload file . commit_message character(1) Git commit message. author_email character(1) Git commit author's email address. NULL means default token owner. author_name character(1) Git commit author's name. NULL means default token owner. incl_stats logical(1) Whether include commit statistics result. force logical(1) Whether overwrite branch new commit based start_branch start_sha. Equivalent git push --force. last_commit_id character(1) Last known file commit identifier. provided (valid), GitLab proceed commit made last_commit_id modified file. Intended avoid concurrency issues (e.g. CI pipelines). NULL means skip check. considered "delete", "move" "update" actions. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: Delete multiple files from GitLab repository — files_delete
text: list metadata created commit, invisibly.

title: Delete multiple files from GitLab repository — files_delete
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gitlab::files_delete(paths = c("test.md", "test_old.md"),                      id_project = 64767928)} # }

title: GitLab project default branch — project_default_branch
text: Determines GitLab project's default Git branch name.

title: GitLab project default branch — project_default_branch
code: project_default_branch(   id_project = pal::pkg_config_val("id_project"),   base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("base_url"),   token = pal::pkg_config_val("token"),   max_tries = 3L )

title: GitLab project default branch — project_default_branch
text: id_project integer(1) GitLab project identifier. base_url character(1) Base URL GitLab v4 RESTful API root. token character(1)GitLab access token used authentication. NULL, API request made unauthenticated results HTTP 404 Found errors non-public resources. max_tries integer(1) Maximum number attempts retry case HTTP error.

title: GitLab project default branch — project_default_branch
text: character scalar.

title: GitLab project default branch — project_default_branch
code: gitlab::project_default_branch(id_project = 64767928) #> [1] "main"
